payload.text:
**Resolving hydration locale mismatch in client components**

This issue stems from differing locales between server-rendered HTML (default "en") and client-rendered content (using saved "de" locale), causing React hydration errors. I'm exploring ways to defer localized rendering until after hydration by gating rendering with mounted flags or using React features like suppressHydrationWarning on specific text nodes to silence mismatch warnings. Iâ€™m balancing avoiding setState in effectsâ€”which triggers lint errorsâ€”while ensuring overlays and localized texts display correctly post-hydration. The plan is to patch SharedTripGuard by adding suppressHydrationWarning on validating texts and ensure the page shows overlays by not blocking rendering during checks, addressing both hydration errors and visibility issues together.

summary.text:
**Resolving hydration locale mismatch in client components**

This issue stems from differing locales between server-rendered HTML (default "en") and client-rendered content (using saved "de" locale), causing React hydration errors. I'm exploring ways to defer localized rendering until after hydration by gating rendering with mounted flags or using React features like suppressHydrationWarning on specific text nodes to silence mismatch warnings. Iâ€™m balancing avoiding setState in effectsâ€”which triggers lint errorsâ€”while ensuring overlays and localized texts display correctly post-hydration. The plan is to patch SharedTripGuard by adding suppressHydrationWarning on validating texts and ensure the page shows overlays by not blocking rendering during checks, addressing both hydration errors and visibility issues together.

**Adjusting overlay visibility and map sizing**

I'm troubleshooting why the overlay's title and date arenâ€™t visible even though the map displays correctly. Suspecting CSS issues like z-index layering, text color opacity, pointer events, and container sizing, I plan to boost the overlay's z-index, tweak background and text colors for contrast, add drop shadows, enlarge the map by 1.5x, and remove any pointer-event restrictions that might hide the text. I'll implement these styling updates in `entry-reader.tsx` and `entry-hero-map` components to ensure the overlay content properly shows up.

content.text:

Added a lightness check for the hero image: the title/date box now only shows the dark background when the image is bright. It samples the hero image in a tiny canvas on load; if the image is light (avg luminance > 175), the box appears; if the image is dark enough, the box is transparent. Please refresh the shared entry page (hard refresh in Safari). If you want the threshold adjusted (more/less sensitive), tell me.

content.text:
Added a lightness check for the hero image: the title/date box now only shows the dark background when the image is bright. It samples the hero image in a tiny canvas on load; if the image is light (avg luminance > 175), the box appears; if the image is dark enough, the box is transparent. This is in `travelblogs/src/components/entries/entry-reader.tsx`.

Please refresh the shared entry page (hard refresh in Safari). If you want the threshold adjusted (more/less sensitive), tell me.

payload.message:
I wired the shared hero map to zoom out to the tripâ€™s full bounds while still showing only the current entry marker.

Changes:
- `travelblogs/src/components/entries/entry-hero-map.tsx` now accepts trip bounds and uses `fitBounds` when multiple locations exist.
- `travelblogs/src/app/trips/share/[token]/entries/[entryId]/page.tsx` now fetches shared trip locations and passes them to the hero map.
- `travelblogs/src/components/entries/entry-reader.tsx` passes those locations into the hero map.

Please refresh the shared entry page and confirm the map now zooms out to show the trip extent while keeping just the single marker.

content.text:
I wired the shared hero map to zoom out to the tripâ€™s full bounds while still showing only the current entry marker.

Changes:
- `travelblogs/src/components/entries/entry-hero-map.tsx` now accepts trip bounds and uses `fitBounds` when multiple locations exist.
- `travelblogs/src/app/trips/share/[token]/entries/[entryId]/page.tsx` now fetches shared trip locations and passes them to the hero map.
- `travelblogs/src/components/entries/entry-reader.tsx` passes those locations into the hero map.

Please refresh the shared entry page and confirm the map now zooms out to show the trip extent while keeping just the single marker.
